definition: miraculous hands of a healer/highly skilled person/brilliant move in chess or weiqi (go) 圍棋|围棋
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
magical hands bring the dying back to life (idiom); miracle cure/brilliant doctor
petty thief (lit. quick fingered and vanish)/empty-handed/having nothing

sentences.english: The two physicians alone could offer any hops when danger was extreme.
sentences.chinese: 只有這兩位醫師能夠妙手回春。

sentences.english: The doctor is highly competent, many patients recover their lost hearing after receiving treatment.
sentences.chinese: 這位醫生妙手回春，不少耳聾的人經治療復聰了。

sentences.english: The academies gathered the most excellent painters in the country.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，國家可以把全國最優秀的丹青妙手匯聚起來。

sentences.english: Doctors cannot effect a cure if the disease has spread too far.
sentences.chinese: 假如這種疾病已擴散得厲害，醫生也無法妙手回春。

sentences.english: The great love warms the weak heart of patients.
sentences.chinese: 大愛春風暖人心，妙手仁心鑄英魂。

sentences.english: "Iron shoulders take duties , smart hands write articles" .
The older uncle buttoned, small beans finally able to speak.
sentences.chinese: 經老五叔妙手回春，小豆子終於能說話了。

sentences.english: The natural healing arts have been with us for ages, and can often be very powerful - by engaging and supporting our body's Innate Wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 自然療法已經伴隨人類多年，並且經常能夠妙手回春。

sentences.english: It was said that she was as effective as god, bringing the dying back to life.
sentences.chinese: 她是個妙手回春的民間醫生。

sentences.english: We all need to turn our idle hands into healing hands.
sentences.chinese: 我們都需要變成妙手仁心我們空閒的手。

definition: lit. set out and it becomes spring (idiom); to effect a miracle cure (of medical operation)/to bring back the dead/once it starts, everything goes well
masterly/subtle and clever (or artwork, writing etc)
to touch base matter and turn it to gold (idiom); fig. to turn crude writing into a literary gem
square cun (Chinese unit of area: 1 cun × 1 cun, or 3⅓ cm × 3⅓ cm)/heart/mind
to touch base matter and turn it to gold (idiom); fig. to turn crude writing into a literary gem
